title.rendered: Online FDP on Recent Trends in AI, ML and VLSI Design and Development by NIT Warangal and Dr. B.C. Roy Engg. College [Feb 28-Mar 9]: Register by Feb 25

content.rendered:
NIT Warangal and Dr. B.C. Roy Engineering College are inviting applications for the online FDP on Recent Trends in AI, ML and VLSI Design and Dev. Apply by Feb 25, 2025!

About NIT Warangal

The National Institute of Technology, Warangal, is the first of 17 Regional Engineering Colleges (RECs) established through a joint venture between the Government of India and the state government. Over time, it has earned a reputation as a premier institution offering high-quality technical education. NIT Warangal provides B.Tech degrees in various engineering disciplines, along with M.Tech and Ph.D. programmes in multiple specializations. Both the B.Tech and M.Tech programmes are accredited by the National Board of Accreditation (NBA).

About BCREC

Dr. B.C. Roy Engineering College (BCREC), established in 2000, is renowned for its strong industrial heritage and entrepreneurial ethos. As one of the first private engineering colleges in West Bengal, BCREC has earned NAAC and NBA accreditation across five disciplines. The college’s partnerships with industry and the establishment of an AICTE IDEA Lab offer students valuable hands-on experience and opportunities for innovation. Recently, the college has been granted autonomous status by the University Grants Commission (UGC) and its affiliating university, MAKAUT.

About Electronics & ICT Academy – Phase II

The “Electronics & ICT Academy – Phase II” was established at NIT Warangal with financial support from MeitY, GoI. The academy focuses on offering Faculty Development Programmes in both standardized courses and emerging areas of Electronics and Information Communication Technologies. It also provides training and consultancy services for industries, curriculum development, Continuing Education Programmes (CEP) for working professionals, and support for technical incubation and entrepreneurial initiatives.

FDP Details

This Faculty Development Programme (FDP) focuses on enhancing knowledge of problem-solving techniques using the latest advancements in AI and ML technologies. Conducted online, it is a joint initiative between the E&ICT Academy at the National Institute of Technology, Warangal, and Dr. B.C. Roy Engineering College, Durgapur, West Bengal. The programme features insights from academicians and industry experts, including those from IITs.

Course Content

  • AI and Data Science: Fundamentals and Applications
  • AI-Based Problem-Solving Techniques
  • Real Life Applications of Machine Learning
  • Soft Computing Applications
  • Deep Learning for Problem Solving
  • Impact of AI on VLSI design
  • VLSI Circuit with IOT Technologies
  • Quantum computing and VLSI
  • Case Study

Selection Criteria

Selection will be made based on a first-come-first-serve basis to a maximum number of 40 (forty). The list of selected participants will be intimated through e-mail. The DD/online payment will be returned if a candidate is not selected. Candidates will be issued satisfactory certificates (both Hard and Soft copy) on successful completion of the course.

Program Details

The program will be conducted by faculty members from NIT Warangal and the Dr. B. C. Roy Engineering College; academicians in the concerned field from IITs/NITs/IIITs/abroad are invited to deliver lectures. Speakers from industries are also expected to provide as part of the course.

Registration Fee

  • Faculty and Research Scholars: Rs. 750/-
  • Industry Participants: Rs. 2250/-

Participants need to pay the Registration Fee Online using the following details:

  • Account Name: Electronics & ICT Academy NITW
  • Account No 62423775910
  • IFSC: SBIN0020149
  • Bank and Branch: State Bank of India, NIT(REC) Warangal

Important Dates

  • Last date (Application): Feb 25, 2025.
  • Selection List by E- mail: Feb 26, 2025.
  • Duration: February 28, 2025 to March 9, 2025
  • Session Time (Online Mode): 3 PM – 7 PM

How to Apply?

Interested and eligible candidates can directly apply here!

Deadline

The application deadline is Feb 25, 2025.

Contact Details

  • Dr. Sujit Das, Assistant Professor, Dept. of CSE, National Institute of Technology Warangal – 506004, Telangana, India
    • +91- 8536009758
    • sujit.das@nitw.ac.in
  • Mrs. Moutusi Mondal, Assistant Professor, Dept. of ECE, Dr. B. C. Roy Engineering, Durgapur– 713206, WB
    • +91-8159085024
    • moutusi.mondal@bcrec.ac.in
